title.narrative: FSDZ Kvinnor och ungdomar i finansiell inkludering WIN 2
FSDZ Women and Youth in Financial Inclusion WIN 2

description.narrative: The WIN 2 programme will contribute to systemic and lasting change, particularly benefiting poor women, youth, and the disabled, through a market systems development approach to financial inclusion and addressing of financial barriers to real sector engagement. The three key work areas are: 1) digitization for financial inclusion, with the aim of reducing transaction costs and increasing market information flows in terms of time and money for poor women, youth, people with disabilities, and their households; 2) financial education, with the aim of improving life conditions of poor women, youth, people with disabilities and their households through improved financial capabilities, leading to improved access to income opportunities, social welfare, basic health and education services; and 3) women and youth savings groups, with the aim of creating agency for women, youth and people with disabilities to improve sustainable income flows, access social services for them and their families, voice opinion and take leadership, as well as enabling increased financial inclusion.

The WIN 2 programme is implemented by Financial Sector Deepening Zambia and is based on lessons learned from the WIN project (June 2016 - February 2020). The time frame for the WIN 2 programme is 2020 to 2025, and the overall budget is SEK 40 million.
The WIN 2 programme will promote greater financial inclusion and capabilities for women, youth, people with disabilities, and their households. The three key work areas are: 1) digitization for financial inclusion; 2) financial education; and 3) women and youth savings groups.
Financial Sector Deepening Zambia will implement this programme together with the Government of Zambia and a number of civil society and private sector partners. Some of the funds will be forwarded to some of these partners.

WIN 2-programmet implementeras av Financial Sector Deepening Zambia och bygger på lärdomar från WIN-projektet (juni 2016 - februari 2020). Tidsramen för WIN 2-programmet är 2020 till 2025 och den totala budgeten är 40 miljoner SEK.
WIN 2-programmet kommer att främja ökad finansiell inkludering och kapacitet för kvinnor, ungdomar, personer med funktionsnedsättning och deras hushåll. De tre viktigaste arbetsområdena är: 1) digitalisering för finansiell integration; 2) finansiell utbildning; och 3) kvinnor och ungdomsbesparingsgrupper.
Financial Sector Deepening Zambia kommer att genomföra detta program tillsammans med Zambias regering och ett antal civilsamhällets organisationer och privata partner. En del av medlen kommer att vidarebefordras till några av dessa partner.

tag.narrative: 1.4 - By 2030, ensure that all men and women, in particular the poor and the vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to basic services, ownership and control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources, appropriate new technology and financial services, including microfinance.

1.4 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla män och kvinnor, i synnerhet de fattiga och de utsatta, har lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, tillgång till grundläggande tjänster, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till arv, naturresurser, lämplig ny teknik och finansiella tjänster, inklusive mikrokrediter.
10.2 - By 2030, empower and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status.

10.2 - Till 2030 möjliggöra och verka för att alla människors, oavsett ålder, kön, funktionsnedsättning, ras, etnicitet, ursprung, religion eller ekonomisk eller annan ställning, blir inkluderade i det sociala, ekonomiska och politiska livet.
17.17 - Encourage and promote effective public, public-private and civil society partnerships, building on the experience and resourcing strategies of partnerships
17.17 - Encourage and promote effective public, public-private and civil society partnerships, building on the experience and resourcing strategies of partnerships.
4.4 - By 2030, substantially increase the number of youth and adults who have relevant skills, including technical and vocational skills, for employment, decent jobs and entrepreneurship.

4.4 - Till 2030 väsentligen öka det antal ungdomar och vuxna som har relevanta färdigheter, däribland tekniska färdigheter och yrkeskunnande, för sysselsättning, anständigt arbete och entreprenörskap.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

5.a - Genomföra reformer för att ge kvinnor lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till finansiella tjänster, arv och naturresurser, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning

5.a - Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control over land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and natural resources, in accordance with national laws.
5.b - Enhance the use of enabling technology, in particular information and communications technology, to promote the empowerment of women.
5.b - Öka användningen av gynnsam teknik, i synnerhet informations- och kommunikationsteknik, för att främja kvinnors egenmakt
8.10 - Strengthen the capacity of domestic financial institutions to encourage and expand access to banking, insurance and financial services for all.
8.10 - Stärka de inhemska finansinstitutens kapacitet att främja och utöka tillgången till bank- och försäkringstjänster samt finansiella tjänster för alla.

title.narrative: Decision on Contribution FSDZ WIN II
